reference_table.comment: Table to represent a testable reference object

inbound_related_reference_table.comment: has two inbound fks to refrence_table

foreign_keys.comment: has from_name
it's not included in record context

association_table_with_toname.comment: has fk to reference_table and inbound_related_reference_table. the fk to inbound_related_reference_table has to_name annotation

foreign_keys.comment: fk to reference_table
fk to inbound_related_reference_table

association table with id.comment: has fk to reference_table and inbound_related_reference_table. has an ID column

foreign_keys.comment: fk to reference_table
fk to inbound_related_reference_table

association_table_with_extra.comment: has fk to reference_table and inbound_related_reference_table. has an extra column. since it has extra columns, it should not be consdered as association

foreign_keys.comment: fk to reference_table
fk to inbound_related_reference_table

reference_values.comment: Table to represent a testable reference object with markdown_pattern values

column_definitions.name: some_markdown
column_definitions.default: **This is some markdown** with some `code` and a [link](http://www.example.com)

table_w_composite_key_2.comment: Table with composite key, has ro_name pattern that represents a link

table_w_composite_key_3.comment: Table with composite key, used for display key seleciton.

table_w_simple_key_fk.comment: this table has one simple key which is a foreign key

reference_table_outbound_fks.comment: reference table with multiple outboud FKRs

foreign_keys.comment: simple fk col_1 to reference with to_name
simple fk col_2 to reference without to_name
simple fk col_3 to reference without to_name
simple fk col_3 to reference_values without to_name
composite fk to table_w_composite_key with to_name
composite fk to table_w_composite_key_2 without to_name
composite fk to table_w_composite_key without to_name
composite fk to reference without to_name
composite fk to reference, one value is null

main-entity-table.comment: Table to represent foreign keys constraining each other

foreign_keys.comment: Foreign key that constrains other foreign key based on selected value.
Foreign key that is constrained by selected value for fk_no_constraint.
Foreign key that is constrained by a static value no matter what.
Foreign key that is constrained by a user input value via text input.
Foreign key that is constrained by a user input value via text input and another fk column value.

column_definitions.comment: Foreign key column that constrains fk_constrained_col's values
column_definitions.name: fk1

column_definitions.comment: Foreign key column constrained by fk1.
column_definitions.name: fk_constrained_col

column_definitions.comment: Foreign key column constrained by fixed term.
column_definitions.name: position_fixed_col

column_definitions.comment: Text field that constrains position_fk_col. Any value is acceptable, only 'fixed', 'relative', and 'absolute' will have an affect.
column_definitions.name: position_text_col

column_definitions.comment: Column constrained by position_text_col input value.
column_definitions.name: position_fk_col

fk-no-constraint-table.comment: Table with values that constrain other foreign key selector.

fk-constrained-table.comment: Table that is constrained by a foreign key value from main-entity-table to fk-no-constraint-table selected value.

foreign_keys.comment: Foreign key that provides the constraint relationship.

column_definitions.comment: Foreign key column to fk-no-constraint-table. Limits the values displayed based on fk annotation on main-entity-table.
column_definitions.name: fk2

column_definitions.comment: Column that can have one of multiple enumerated values: 'fixed', 'absolute', 'relative'
column_definitions.name: position_col

position-type-table.comment: Table with rows populated with an enum column.

column_definitions.comment: Column that can have one of multiple enumerated values: 'fixed', 'absolute', 'relative'
column_definitions.name: position_type_col
